critique: This document delegates authority related to critical defense housing areas to the Secretary of Defense and the Director of Defense Mobilization. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt, immigration approach, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion based solely on this delegation of power. The delegation itself doesn't inherently expand executive power, but it does centralize decision-making at the federal level. Given that it relates to defense housing, a slight lean towards national security could be argued.
